chargeHist.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Loukane Scott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Loukane Scott in court.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status of counsel.  The Public Defender's Office has not yet appointed counsel.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Loukane Scott in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Loukane Scott.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Court grants Defense's motion to withdraw as counsel due to conflict. Court vacated jury trial date set for 10-24-2022.  Court set a status of counsel date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Loukane Scott in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 8-31-2022 and all responses to be filed by 9-28-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Loukane Scott in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Loukane Scott in court in person with Attorney Fred Richardson who appears by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Bradford. Court took judicial notice of 1st degree RES as a Class D felony. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Loukane Scott in court in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Fred Richardson to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M. Barksdale, Drekail M.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Loukane Scott in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Loukane Scott in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Loukane Scott appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
